questions.question: Where did Dick Whittington live originally?
questions.answer: A village in south England

questions.question: What made Dick go to London?

options.text: Hearing streets were paved with gold

questions.answer: Hearing streets were paved with gold

questions.question: Who gave Dick a lift to London?
questions.answer: A carter

questions.question: Where did Dick sleep on his first night in London?
questions.answer: An alley

questions.question: Who helped Dick get work?
questions.answer: Mr Fitzwarren

questions.question: What work was Dick given?
questions.answer: Helping in the kitchen

questions.question: Where did Dick sleep at Mr Fitzwarren’s house?
questions.answer: Attic

questions.question: What troubled Dick at night?
questions.answer: Rats and mice

questions.question: How did Dick solve the rat problem?
questions.answer: Buying a cat

questions.question: Who treated Dick badly at the house?
questions.answer: The cook

questions.question: Where did Dick Whittington live originally?
questions.answer: A village in south England

questions.question: What made Dick go to London?

options.text: Hearing streets were paved with gold

questions.answer: Hearing streets were paved with gold

questions.question: Who gave Dick a lift to London?
questions.answer: A carter

questions.question: Where did Dick sleep on his first night in London?
questions.answer: An alley

questions.question: Who helped Dick get work?
questions.answer: Mr Fitzwarren

questions.question: What work was Dick given?
questions.answer: Helping in the kitchen

questions.question: Where did Dick sleep at Mr Fitzwarren’s house?
questions.answer: Attic

questions.question: What troubled Dick at night?
questions.answer: Rats and mice

questions.question: How did Dick solve the rat problem?
questions.answer: Buying a cat

questions.question: Who treated Dick badly at the house?
questions.answer: The cook

questions.question: Why was Dick unhappy in his village?
questions.answer: He had no parents and was treated unkindly by villagers.

questions.question: What innocent belief did Dick have about London?
questions.answer: He believed the streets of London were paved with gold.

questions.question: Why was Dick disappointed on reaching London?
questions.answer: He saw dirty streets and unfriendly people instead of gold.

questions.question: How did Mr Fitzwarren help Dick?
questions.answer: He gave Dick food, shelter, and work.

questions.question: What was Dick’s first difficulty at the house?
questions.answer: The attic was full of rats and mice.

questions.question: How did the cat help Dick?
questions.answer: The cat chased away all the rats and mice.

questions.question: What was Dick’s second difficulty?
questions.answer: The cook’s bad temper.

questions.question: Why did Dick decide to leave the house?
questions.answer: He could not tolerate the cook’s scoldings.

questions.question: What made Dick return back?
questions.answer: The church bells inspired him.

questions.question: What message did the bells seem to give?
questions.answer: They told him to turn again and become Lord Mayor.
